name: Great Wyrm White Dragon
movement: 40 ft. walk, 40 ft. burrow, 80 ft. fly, 40 ft. swim
description: The Great Wyrm White Dragon is a colossal creature with gleaming white scales and icy breath, embodying the harshness of winter. It has fearsome claws and a long, formidable tail.
memorable: Known for its devastating breath weapon and control over icy terrain, the creature can intimidate foes from a distance and command the battlefield with spells.
goals: To assert dominance over its territory, hunt for prey, and exert control over weaker creatures.
relations: May be found in the company of other icy creatures or as a master over lesser dragons and beasts.
environment: Typically resides in icy mountains, frozen tundras, or cold caverns.
strengths: Immune to cold damage, excels in intimidation, and possesses potent spellcasting abilities.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to attacks not dealing cold damage, lacks significant resistances to non-cold energies.
attacks: Can bite for piercing damage and cold, claw for slashing damage, and tail for bludgeoning, along with powerful breath attacks that freeze its enemies.
most_powerful_ability: Cold Breath, releasing a devastating cone of frost that halts movement and deals massive cold damage.
senses: Possesses blindsight at 60 feet and a very high passive perception of 23, allowing it to detect foes easily.
skills: Skilled in intimidation and perception, enhancing it as a fearsome predator.
additional_information: Cold Mastery allows movement and vision to be unhindered by icy conditions.
Legendary Resistance enables it to negate failed saving throws.
Heart of Winter recharges its breath weapon after taking significant damage.
Can initiate attacks with abilities like Spit Ice and Raging Storm.
Capable of manipulating the battlefield with spells like wall of ice and sleet storm.
spellcasting: Innate spellcasting includes dominating beasts and creating severe weather effects.
test_queries: mythical white dragon in frozen mountains
